structure.unit: RIOT, DISORDERLY CONDUCT, AND RELATED OFFENSES

text.section:
A person is guilty of unlawful assembly when:
He assembles with five (5) or more persons for the purpose of engaging or preparing to engage with them in a riot; or
Being present at an assembly which either has or develops such a purpose, he remains there with intent to advance that purpose.
Unlawful assembly is a Class B misdemeanor.

law.history: Created 1974 Ky. Acts ch. 406, sec. 215, effective January 1, 1975.
